description: Numbers n such that n remains prime through 4 iterations of function f(x) = 9x + 2.
comments: n, 9*n+2, 81*n+20, 729*n+182 and 6561*n+1640 are primes. [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: Select[Prime[Range[11000]],AllTrue[Rest[NestList[9#+2&,#,4]],PrimeQ]&] (* The program uses the AllTrue function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Feb 12 2015 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [n: n in [1..5000000] | IsPrime(n) and IsPrime(9*n+2) and IsPrime(81*n+20) and IsPrime(729*n+182) and IsPrime(6561*n+1640)] [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
author: _David W. Wilson_
